bibl.title: Bunnell and Bunnell v. Isbell. Defendant Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: Ed. Bunnell and Arthur Bunnell has been rendered in the above entitiled Court for the sum of $15-, fifteen dollars eachof said defendant and for the costs and disbursements of this action, taxed at ($65.80) Sixty five dollars and Eight cents, on the 8th day of September A.D., 1888. Now there we Ed.F.Osborn and John A.Jackson, as sureties hereby agree to pay and acknowledge ourselves bound in the sum of ($95.80), Ninety five dollars and Eighty cents: This bond to be void if such Judgment shall be paid, at the expiration of thirty days after the date it was rendered. Witness our hands and seald this, the 11th day of September, A.D. 1888.

and thereupon were discharged from custody on said day and have been at liverty since under said Bond, and affiant denies that at any times since said 11th day of September, A.D., 1888 he has unlawfully or otherwise imprisoned, detained, confined or restrained said E.Bunnell or Arthur Bunnell or eithe rof them for any cause at all, and denies that said Edgar Bunnell adn Arthur Bunnellor either of them were at any time illegally confined, imprisoned or restrained.
Denies that the complaint in said action does not conform to or charge an offence under Section "12" of ordinance "8" of the Town of Garfield, as by law required.

And affiant alleges that the acts herein stated on the misrefend to in the petition and denies that the said Court did not have jurisdiction of said offen and denies that said Thomas Kennedy act so police Judge Meg
